issue.title: Fix #10555 #6888 Backslash in Prometheus variables
issue.body:
Prior this commit, `C:\bar` was escaped `C:\\\bar`. Should be `C:\\\\bar`.

Signed-off-by: Julien Pivotto <roidelapluie@inuits.eu>

issue.title: Postgres datasource provisioning problems
issue.body:
### What Grafana version are you using?
5.0.3
### What datasource are you using?
Postgres

### What OS are you running grafana on?
Docker container 

### What did you do?
Created a datasources.yml file with the following content: 

``` 
# list of datasources that should be deleted from the database
delete_datasources:

# list of datasources to insert/update depending
# whats available in the datbase
datasources:
- name: pg-dashboard
  type: postgres
  access: proxy
  url: postgres:5432
  password: "password"
  user: "grafanareader"
  database: "dashboard"
  basicAuth: false
  is_default: true
  editable: true
  json_data:
    ssl_mode: "disable"
```

The problem is the sslMode setting - which is not working. 

I have also tried this with : 
```
  json_data:
    ssl_mode: "disable"
``` 

and 

``` 
  jsonData:
    sslMode: "disable"
```  

None of which seem to work. 

What is the correct syntax? 

### What was the expected result?
Fully provisoned postgres datasource

### What happened instead?
ssl mode is set to `require`- which means I have to manually change the setting on a new system before things work.

issue.title: Postgres datasource provisioning problems
issue.body:
### What Grafana version are you using?
5.0.3
### What datasource are you using?
Postgres

### What OS are you running grafana on?
Docker container 

### What did you do?
Created a datasources.yml file with the following content: 

``` 
# list of datasources that should be deleted from the database
delete_datasources:

# list of datasources to insert/update depending
# whats available in the datbase
datasources:
- name: pg-dashboard
  type: postgres
  access: proxy
  url: postgres:5432
  password: "password"
  user: "grafanareader"
  database: "dashboard"
  basicAuth: false
  is_default: true
  editable: true
  json_data:
    ssl_mode: "disable"
```

The problem is the sslMode setting - which is not working. 

I have also tried this with : 
```
  json_data:
    ssl_mode: "disable"
``` 

and 

``` 
  jsonData:
    sslMode: "disable"
```  

None of which seem to work. 

What is the correct syntax? 

### What was the expected result?
Fully provisoned postgres datasource

### What happened instead?
ssl mode is set to `require`- which means I have to manually change the setting on a new system before things work.

issue.title: Postgres datasource provisioning problems
issue.body:
### What Grafana version are you using?
5.0.3
### What datasource are you using?
Postgres

### What OS are you running grafana on?
Docker container 

### What did you do?
Created a datasources.yml file with the following content: 

``` 
# list of datasources that should be deleted from the database
delete_datasources:

# list of datasources to insert/update depending
# whats available in the datbase
datasources:
- name: pg-dashboard
  type: postgres
  access: proxy
  url: postgres:5432
  password: "password"
  user: "grafanareader"
  database: "dashboard"
  basicAuth: false
  is_default: true
  editable: true
  json_data:
    ssl_mode: "disable"
```

The problem is the sslMode setting - which is not working. 

I have also tried this with : 
```
  json_data:
    ssl_mode: "disable"
``` 

and 

``` 
  jsonData:
    sslMode: "disable"
```  

None of which seem to work. 

What is the correct syntax? 

### What was the expected result?
Fully provisoned postgres datasource

### What happened instead?
ssl mode is set to `require`- which means I have to manually change the setting on a new system before things work.

comment.body:
You need to provide the password using `secureJsonData` property:

```yaml
...
secureJsonData:
 password: "..."
```

Just by looking at the json data posted (chrome dev tools for example) when creating a new postgres datasource I see the following:

```json
{
  "name": "Test pg",
  "type": "postgres",
  "url": "localhost:5432",
  "access": "proxy",
  "jsonData": { "keepCookies": [], "sslmode": "disable" },
  "secureJsonFields": {},
  "database": "test",
  "user": "test",
  "secureJsonData": { "password": "test" }
}
```

Of course the provision configuration is yaml, but supports the same camelCase json properties.

Closing this since it's no bug.

issue.title: [Feature request] Option to disable dashboard history
issue.body:
Hi all,

we have just updated to Grafana 4.4. Some of our dashboards are automatically generated and frequently updated. Due to the new dashboard history feature, our database size has suddenly increased significantly. Can you please add an option to disable dashboard versioning globally?

Thanks and Best Regards,

  Jochen.

issue.title: [Feature Request] Constant Variable Without Quotes for use in MySQL Query
issue.body:
Hi,
I am trying to make a dashboard more portable, so I want to include variables that a user can use to change the table that a MySQL query selects from. I tried using the constant and it inserted into the query with single quotes like: SELECT * FROM 'myTableName', which gives an error because the correct syntax is SELECT * FROM myTableName.

If there is already a way to do this, then I'm sorry for posting here, but I cannot find a way and I know that it would be appreciated if it could be added.

Thanks!

comment.body:
Thanks again, Mike

We will be debating this in a FR.

Cheers!

issue.title: [Feature Request] Constant Variable Without Quotes for use in MySQL Query
issue.body:
Hi,
I am trying to make a dashboard more portable, so I want to include variables that a user can use to change the table that a MySQL query selects from. I tried using the constant and it inserted into the query with single quotes like: SELECT * FROM 'myTableName', which gives an error because the correct syntax is SELECT * FROM myTableName.

If there is already a way to do this, then I'm sorry for posting here, but I cannot find a way and I know that it would be appreciated if it could be added.

Thanks!

comment.body: I don't think that is possible in Grafana. You can define a variable on the dashboard that allows the user to manually put in data, but I don't know of a way to get a variable per logged in user. Maybe you should make a feature request for that.

commits.message: changelog: adds note about closing issues

issue.title: [Feature Request] Constant Variable Without Quotes for use in MySQL Query
issue.body:
Hi,
I am trying to make a dashboard more portable, so I want to include variables that a user can use to change the table that a MySQL query selects from. I tried using the constant and it inserted into the query with single quotes like: SELECT * FROM 'myTableName', which gives an error because the correct syntax is SELECT * FROM myTableName.

If there is already a way to do this, then I'm sorry for posting here, but I cannot find a way and I know that it would be appreciated if it could be added.

Thanks!

comment.body:
Thanks for fast reply, 

Maybe you can determine better if this feature could somehow fit for the use case we are figuring out. We need to define a per-user constant value, which forces all charts access to a certain subset of data. I.e. `SELECT metrics WHERE provider='XX' ...` where the XX should be taken from the logged in user context.

Do you think it might be doable using this?

Thanks!

issue.body:
It should be possible to send emails to an SMTP server that doesn't require TLS connections. 

ref #7116

issue.title: [Bug] Elasticsearch Singlestat Panel Unique Count on string field

comment.body:
Elasticsearch doesn't support year as an interval:
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/common-options.html#time-units

But you can use days: e.g. "730d" for 2 years.

This workaround works for me. Use Unique Count as metric, a large number of days as interval. You'll get one value in your time series, so you can then use "Current", "Average" or "Total" stat, to get the total unique count over the selected time range.

issue.title: [Bug] - Alerts from hidden panels are not working when using webhook notification channel
issue.body:
What Grafana version are you using?
Version 5.0.2

What datasource are you using?
influxdb

What OS are you running grafana on?
Amazon Linux AMI

Hi,
I've configured alert notification channel to send alerts to Opsgenie via webhook.
I'm using two notification channels in my alert configuration: Email & Opsgenie
When I collapse a row with alerting graph and save the dashboard an email regarding the alert is being sent to the designated email address but the Opsgenie integration via webhook is not working and the alert is not being opened in OpgGenie.

If I extend a row with alerting graph and save the dashboard, both email & OpsGenie notification channels are working fine.

issue.title: [Bug] - Alerts from hidden panels are not working when using webhook notification channel
issue.body:
What Grafana version are you using?
Version 5.0.2

What datasource are you using?
influxdb

What OS are you running grafana on?
Amazon Linux AMI

Hi,
I've configured alert notification channel to send alerts to Opsgenie via webhook.
I'm using two notification channels in my alert configuration: Email & Opsgenie
When I collapse a row with alerting graph and save the dashboard an email regarding the alert is being sent to the designated email address but the Opsgenie integration via webhook is not working and the alert is not being opened in OpgGenie.

If I extend a row with alerting graph and save the dashboard, both email & OpsGenie notification channels are working fine.

comment.body:
Dupe of https://github.com/grafana/grafana/issues/11296

We will release 5.0.4 during the day with that fix.
